intro: Elatostema sessile, commonly known as the sessile elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Elatostema sessile is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its preference for well-drained soils.
